stimulusHtml: A horizontal platform with rotational inertia Ip is spinning about a central axis with negligible friction, as shown. A ball of clay with rotational inertia about its center Ic, where Ic<Ip, is dropped onto, and sticks to, the center of the platform. Which of the following claims about the magnitude of the angular impulse exerted on the platform by the clay is true?
choicesHtml: It is greater than the magnitude of the angular impulse exerted on the clay by the platform.
It is less than the magnitude of the angular impulse exerted on the clay by the platform, but greater than zero.
It is equal to the magnitude of the angular impulse exerted on the clay by the platform.
The impulse exerted on each object cannot be compared without knowing the relative masses of the clay and platform.
